result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevante Ramone Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $8,000.00 to be paid to Radio Shack.  Joint and several with Bryan Sanders 15CF461 and Trevor Young 15CF463.

Pay all costs, restitution, surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done.  To be paid out of up to 25% prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for the  Challenge Incarceration program and the Wisconsin Substance Absue Program after serving three (3) years Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Kristal S., all Radio Shacks in Milwaukee County and the coactors Bryan Sanders, Trevor Young.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include:  those as listed.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevante Ramone Young

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trevante Ramone Young in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Trevante Ramone Young in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The state complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 7 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 4 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims: Kristal S, all Radio Shacks in Milwaukee County and the co-actors:  Bryan Sanders, Trevor Young.
*Seek and maintain full time.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $8,000.00 to be paid to Radio Shack, joint and several with Bryan Sanders 15CF461 and Trevor Young 15CF463.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  
- Pay all costs, restitution, surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.      
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court appearing by telephone, defendant Trevante Ramone Young not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Assistant District Attorney James C. Griffin not available for today's proceedings.  Defense counsel telephoned not feeling well and requests new date.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Trevante Ramone Young not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Court in trial.  Defense counsel requests new date.    Case adjourned for  sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Trevante Ramone Young not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Parties requests case be adjourned.   Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Trevante Ramone Young not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requested new date.   Ccase adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevante Ramone Young in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Trevante Ramone Young in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered defandant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Trevante Ramone Young not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendare for Projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Court in trial.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
filed.

  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, Defendant Trevante Ramone Young not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.   COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Trevante Ramone Young in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Trevante Ramone Young in custody.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kristal S. or Radio Shack located at 1844 S. 15th Street Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

Defendant Trevante Ramone Young in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Trevante Ramone Young in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
